Without a sufficient oxygen supply, tissues suffer from the effects of apoptosis and necrosis. Incorporation of oxygen-releasing materials into scaffolds can help address this challenge. This paper provides an overview of the recent developments and technological advances in engineering oxygen-releasing biomaterials to improve the viability and function of cells and prevent hypoxic tissue death. Recent advances in different types of oxygen-releasing materials, mechanisms of oxygen generation, and their applications are discussed.
